data.name: Intro
data.value:
Welcome to DevOpsAssistant! This page explains how each section can help you manage your workflow.

Explore the tools below to review your backlog and generate insights that drive better planning.

data.name: Epics
data.value:
Load a backlog to visualize Epics and Features. Suggested states appear when parents differ from their children.

Apply those suggestions to keep your hierarchy consistent.

data.name: Validation
data.value:
Select a backlog and states then check work items against your rules.

Violations can be tagged for follow up so nothing slips through the cracks.

data.name: Quality
data.value:
Generate a detailed prompt to score stories against INVEST and provide coaching using your Definition of Ready.

Long prompts are split into partsâ€”navigate between them with the arrows.

data.name: RequirementsPlanner
data.value:
Break wiki pages or uploaded documents into a plan of Epics, Features and Stories, then create work items.

Use HTML in descriptions and acceptance criteria when it helps with lists or formatting. Imported text is rendered automatically so you can verify markup.

data.name: ReleaseNotes
data.value:
Select stories and build a prompt that summarizes them for release notes.

Prompts can be copied or downloaded, splitting into parts with arrows to navigate.

data.name: BulkTag
data.value: Choose multiple work items, pick one or more tags, and apply them all at once.

data.name: Metrics
data.value:
Display throughput, lead time, cycle time, velocity, burn up and flow charts for the chosen backlog.

Throughput counts the work items closed in each period. Lead time is the number of days from Created Date to Closed Date. Cycle time measures Activated Date to Closed Date. Velocity sums Story Points or Original Estimate for completed stories. The burn up forecast uses additional points, efficiency and error range, while cumulative flow tracks backlog, work in progress and done items each day.

Use these charts to spot trends and plan future iterations.

data.name: BranchHealth
data.value:
View repository branches and highlight stale branches or ahead/behind counts compared to a base branch.

Regularly cleaning up old branches keeps your repo tidy.

data.name: Settings
data.value:
Configure your DevOps organization, DevOps project and PAT token using the settings dialog. Use the project dropdown to add or switch projects.

You can also customize prompts and validation rules. Create a PAT from your profile menu in Azure DevOps and select New Token. See {0} for instructions. The organization name is the first segment after dev.azure.com/ in the URL and the project name appears next to the home icon when viewing a project.
